column4: what's the name of the popup blocker things for firefox please?
popup blocking is built in to Firefox. Tools>Options>Content>"Block pop-up windows" =/
its supposed to be blocking them .. i upgraded did it turn that off?

remove the . from the end of the URL
That error message is about another repository you added for Opera, not about Skype. Ubuntu Tweak wouldn't fix it.
i see .. so now what?
I'm trying to find the right key. one sec.
thanks
there's instructions at http://deb.opera.com/ for adding the new key
thanks :)
i wonder if i need to unistall the old key?
ugh. apparently they used the old key to sign the Release file on the repository you're using. The issue's on their side, not yours >.>
oh ok.. umm .. so...

you could temporarily disable the repository and then try again in a few days. Add a # at the start of the line in /etc/apt/sources.list.d/opera.list that doesn't have one, or uncheck the relevant line in Software Sources
(and when it's disabled, it won't interfere with Skype install)
that file says it's read only and won't let me save & exit
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list.d/opera.list, or gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list.d/opera.list
(nano is a command-line editor, gedit is a GUI one. you'd run either of those commands in the terminal)
thank you - i like vi(m) . gedit is ok.
opera irc support isn't up to ubuntu standards
11.04 (as the name implies) came out in April. If you mean 11.10, try #ubuntu+1 ;)
